channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report X-2023081168
item.description:
Report X-2023081168

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: SPARROWS POINT
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged in transit on trailer 833647 out of 170 hrbg.outer container was wet.upon inspection all four bottles had loose caps leaking out approx 40 oz of content total. DescribePack: failure was due to loose caps causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: chemical neutralizer and fold absorb were used to address spill.Package was placed in hazmat tote and put under ventilation system.

item.title: Report E-2023090112
item.description:
Report E-2023090112

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: BALTIMORE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 5 gallon pail of adhesive (un1133) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 quart of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
